author: Chieko Tsuneoka
title: American Allies Urge Trade Peace as China and the U.S. Bump Heads
text:
BRUSSELS—U.S. trading partners grappled Friday with the fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariffs that hit both allies and rivals, seeking to avert trade wars amid uncertainties about the White House’s moves.
Countries reacted with a mix of anger and calm as many started incurring U.S. import tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminum. Australia, South Korea, the European Union and others clinched temporary waivers until May 1 while they negotiate with Washington.
...
